topic.title: How to Use Custom Parameters in XSLT Stylesheets

body.p: Suppose you want to add an attribute with a custom value inside a div element.

To add this functionality using a DITA-OT plugin, follow these steps: In the \plugins\ folder, create a folder for this plugin (for example, com.oxygenxml.pdf.css.param). Create a plugin.xml file (in the folder you created in step 1) that specifies the extension points, your parameter file, and your customization stylesheet. For example: The com.oxygenxml.pdf.css.xsl.merged2html5 extension point can also be called from a Publishing Template. Create a params.xml file that specifies the name of the custom attribute with the following content: Create your customization stylesheet (for example, custom.xsl) with the following content:
Use the Run DITA-OT Integrator transformation scenarioRun DITA-OT Integrator transformation scenario found in the DITA Map section in the Configure Transformation Scenario(s) dialog box. Duplicate the transformation scenario, then in the Parameters tab click New to create a new parameter (e.g. named custom.param with the value of customValue). Run the transformation scenario.
